content.description: Easier variation of Blind Electrician. Links up with Electron early, so for your own safety, clean the north/northwest face of choss before climbing.
content.protection: Pad over the large low rock to the left of the tree below Electron.
content.location: Left of Electron. Start with two hands on the first crack at eye level (same start as Blind Electrician).

content.description: Slab problem until you reach the crack, then fun simple movements to an easy topout.
content.protection: One pad right below the topout.
content.location: Opposite side of the boulder from the road (right of Electron, below obvious crack)

content.description: Clearly hasn't been climbed in years. Overgrown with moss and lichen, but fun, tall route on good holds.
content.protection: Clean this rock well before climbing.
content.location:
"...the northwest corner of the rock."

Right next to the tree on the tallest face of the rock.

content.description: Powerful mantel problem. Start on the obvious jug on the roadside block. Scramble and balance is the name of the game.
content.location: Roadside under the large obvious block. Start on the left side of the jug.

content.description:
A tad contrived but a good climb. Essentially stick to the blank face and arete as much as possible.

Start with two hands on the north face crack (caked in chalk above a large block). Pull over to the crimp around the corner. The next move is a stretch to a sloped arete about two feet above the crimp. Continue up the face for a few moves until the holds run dry, then transfer right, to the northwest face and finish on the sloping holds to the crack on the highest point of the boulder to top out in the tree branches. Don't simply cross over to the jugs using the crimp edge, or you're climbing Rewired.
content.protection: One pad covering the rock poking out of the fall zone.
content.location: North face of Powerline Rock. Start is the low crack at about eye level.
